job_title: RN Case Manager in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Flexible, good pay, knowledgeable staffs, can work together, help each other
cons: Management changes frequently.However not really effect to nurses.

job_title: Palliative Care RN in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Sign on bonus I guess? It was small and you only get a small amount of it until you stay for 6 months and then 12 months.
cons: Unprofessional leadership Lack of transparency Minimal oversight or accountability Management would pick and choose what to pay attention to Old facility and charting/technology Short staffing Almost no training, immediately given large case loads and no one interested in correcting it Felt fraud-y Dangerous environment to practice in

pros: work life balance decrease territories improved leadership
cons: benefits could be better but still satisfied

job_title: Home Health RN Case Manager PER VISIT in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Pay per visit option
Lots of independence
cons:
Poor mgmt
Poor scheduling systems (for patients, not employees)

review_title: We have a new interim CEO.  So things may be looking up!!!
pros: Used to be proud of our organization and our commitment to providing care to everyone, We used to take the cases that other agencies turned down,. They used to value education and expertise.
cons: Organization has been gutted. General feeling of distrust in the office, although there are still some really wonderful people

pros: Get to be outside on nice days
cons: Management doesn’t care if they send you all over Philadelphia with 45 minute commutes between patients, which they don’t schedule into your time so you’re always running late. They don’t give you time to do your charting so you work for hours at home every night, unpaid. There is no consistency. Super high turnover. No PPE.

job_title: Home Health RN Case Manager in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Pay is good but that’s all
cons: Management supports a bullying and toxic work environment

pros: Semi-flexible schedule, wonderful co-workers, fair wages
cons: New upper management is beyond poor, Nepotism, racial prejudice, high deductible insurance, the company really showed their lack of concern for their employees during COVID19. They were unwilling to even follow the lead of other hospices and hospitals in how to handle the crisis.

pros: The best place I've ever had in my experience. The co-workers are very responsible and the management are always on hand to help at any time. Patients' compensation is their goal and in my experience they blame it. It has very good benefits, as very few companies have it and I do not regret being a part of it.
cons: There are some little things like any other company, but for me it is the best company.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Very supportive co workers and very flexible schedule
cons: Management change brought about shady staff cuts which caused existing staff to be overworked with very large caseloads

job_title: RN Case Manager in Philadelphia, PA
pros: pay is good, lots of time out of the office since it's a home health job
cons: charting takes a lot of extra time, drive times are sometimes extensive due to traffic

pros: Good pay and benefits. Work with great patients that truly need care. LPN's are a great asset and aid to the RNs
cons: Worst group of management I have ever dealt with. Unrealistic expectations. No experience in the field. A complete joke.   Nurses  are treated with no respect. We are disposable. They can always find more

job_title: RN Case Manager in Phila, PA
pros: Flexible schedule, work one weekend every 5-7 weeks, 2 holidays year, friendly office staff and managers
cons: high deductible health insurance, provide better phone service to field staff
